text: The United States National Climatic Data Center (NCDC) in Asheville, North Carolina is the world's largest active archive of weather data. The center became established in late 1951, and moved into a new facility in early 1952. The center collects data on climate change, science, and transportation. ==References== Category:Organizations based in North Carolina Category:Climate change Category:Scientific organizations based in the United States Category:1951 establishments in the United States Category:1950s establishments in North Carolina
title: National Climatic Data Center
